rainyday.title: A Message for a Rainy Day - Date Plan
rainyday.subtitle: Date Plan
rainyday.heroTitle: A Message for a Rainy Day
rainyday.heroSubtitle: Create a personal Emotional First-Aid Kit filled with love, warmth, and heartfelt words for the future
rainyday.sectionTitle: The Process: "Warmth at the Tip of Your Pen"

checklist.title: The Tools
items: Beautiful paper
elegant envelopes
your favorite pens or even a quill and ink

checklist.title: The Props
items: Sealing wax and a stamp (for maximum atmosphere)
dried flowers or leaves to tuck inside the envelope

checklist.title: The Vibe
items: Soft, dim lighting
a few lit candles
calm background music (gentle jazz, instrumental melodies, or the soothing sound of rain outside)

dresscode.title: Keepers of the Cozy
dresscode.description: Fluffy robes, warm blankets, and woolly socks

dresscode.title: Rainy Day Poets
dresscode.description: Oversized sweaters, reading glasses, and a thoughtful mood

dresscode.title: Pajama Classic
dresscode.description: Your most loved, most comfortable pajamas

topics.title: What to Write About
items: Recall a moment when you felt truly proud of your partner
Describe the 3 qualities you adore most about them
Give a funny, sweet piece of advice for when they feel like they're "dropping all the balls"
Bring your shared dream to life by painting a vibrant picture of it

steps.title: The Letter Workshop
steps.subtitle: Words for the Future
steps.content: Settle into your cozy corners and write your partner a letter that is sincere, warm, and completely unguarded. The main goal is to be a source of support and to bring a genuine smile to their face when the letter is finally opened down the road.
ideas: Tuck in something symbolic: A ticket stub from your first movie date, a pressed flower, or a tiny doodle
Spritz the paper with your signature scent to add an extra dimension of memory

steps.title: The Sealing Ritual
steps.subtitle: Creating the Secret
steps.content: Once finished, the letters are folded and sealed in their envelopes. The contents must remain a complete secret until Day "X." That element of intrigue is what creates the real magic.
ideas: Use a wax seal with your initials or a heart symbol
Invent and draw your own coat of arms or a secret couple's sign on the envelope

steps.title: Rules of the Game
steps.subtitle: When to Open the Envelope
steps.content: Discuss and agree on the one condition that will allow each of you to break the seal. This rule must be the same for both of you. It could be an emotional state or a specific situation.
ideas: "Open when you feel like you're alone"
"Open after our silliest fight"
"Open on the day the rain outside is the grimmest and gloomiest"

steps.title: The Final Act
steps.subtitle: The Time Capsule
steps.content: Pick a special place for your lettersâ€”a beautiful decorative box, an old wine crate, or a secret shelf in the bookcaseâ€”where they will wait for their moment.
ideas: Take a photo as you place the letters into their "vault." That picture will be the very first exhibit in your future "Gallery of Warm Memories"

cinemarevelation.title: Cinema Revelation - Date Plan
cinemarevelation.subtitle: Date Plan
cinemarevelation.heroSubtitle: This evening isn't just about moviesâ€”it's a chance to know each other more deeply through the stories that shaped you

checklist.title: Tickets
items: 3 films from each person that hold special meaning (from childhood, youth, or connected to an important event)

checklist.title: Cinema Bar
items: Popcorn (salty and sweet)
nachos
favorite drinks and treats

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Curtains drawn
soft glow of string lights
soundtracks from favorite films playing in the background

dresscode.title: Red Carpet on the Couch
dresscode.description: Silk pajamas or cozy robes

dresscode.title: Couch Critics
dresscode.description: Comfortable sweaters, glasses, and blankets

dresscode.title: Blockbuster Heroes
dresscode.description: Fun onesies or pajamas with favorite characters

topics.title: Discussion Topics
items: Why is this film so important to you?
Which scenes trigger the strongest emotions?
Which character resonates with you most?
What personal stories are connected to this movie?
Which of your mutual friends do the characters remind you of?
What unexpected sides did you discover in each other?

steps.title: Pre-Show: Secret Selection
steps.subtitle: Choosing Tonight's Feature
steps.content: Each person prepares a list of three significant films. Take turns briefly explaining why these movies are dear to you, without revealing everything and without naming your top favorite. After the presentations, each of you chooses one film from your partner's list for tonight's viewing.
ideas: Create an intriguing description for each film on your list, like a movie poster
Draw lots if the choice is too difficult

steps.title: First Act: Their Story
steps.subtitle: Watching with Intent
steps.content: You watch the film chosen from your partner's list. Your task isn't just to follow the plot, but to try to feel why this movie is so important to them. Which scenes trigger emotions? Which character resonates with them?
ideas: Keep a notebook handy and discreetly jot down your guesses or moments when your partner reacted strongly
Try to guess their favorite quote from the film

steps.title: Intermission: Trading Theories
steps.subtitle: The Discussion
steps.content: After watching the first film, have a discussion. Start with guesses: "I think this film speaks to you because..." Then your partner reveals the real reason and shares personal stories connected to the movie.
ideas: Create your own rating system: not stars, but maybe "popcorn kernels" or "cozy blankets"
Discuss which of your mutual friends the characters remind you of

steps.title: Final Act: Our Shared Filmography
steps.subtitle: Building Your Collection
steps.content: Switch roles, watch the film from your list, and repeat the ritual with discussion. At the end, compare impressions: what unexpected sides did you discover in each other?
ideas: Start a list in your phone notes or in a beautiful notebook called "Our Golden Film Collection." Add these two films and agree to keep adding to it after each movie night like this

whisperofpages.title: Whisper of Pages - Date Plan
whisperofpages.subtitle: Date Plan
whisperofpages.heroSubtitle: Sometimes, to take a journey, you don't need to leave home. This evening is dedicated to the magic of reading aloud
whisperofpages.sectionTitle: The Process: "When the Story Comes Alive"

checklist.title: Script
items: A short story (30-60 minutes of reading) that neither of you knows yet

checklist.title: Refreshments
items: Hot chocolate
cocoa with marshmallows
or mulled wine
light cookies

checklist.title: Audience Seating
items: A cozy nest of pillows and blankets
dim light from a floor lamp or candles

dresscode.title: Librarians
dresscode.description: Cozy cardigans, warm socks, and perhaps glasses for gravitas

dresscode.title: Storytellers
dresscode.description: Soft pajamas or onesies that make it easy to imagine yourself as a character

dresscode.title: Book Club
dresscode.description: Comfortable sweatshirts and blankets you can wrap yourself in completely

topics.title: Story Suggestions
items: Ray Bradbury â€” "The Vacation" or "The Smile" (short, warm, with a touch of melancholy)
O. Henry â€” "The Gift of the Magi" (a classic that always touches the heart deeply)
Alexander Green â€” "The Green Lamp" (a bit fairy-tale-like with faith in dreams)
Ursula K. Le Guin â€” "The Ones Who Walk Away from Omelas" (short, philosophical, sparks long discussions)
Haruki Murakami â€” "On Seeing the 100% Perfect Girl One Beautiful April Morning" (tender and slightly absurd)

steps.title: Role Distribution: Narrator and Voice
steps.subtitle: Setting Up the Performance
steps.content: Decide how you'll read. You can take turnsâ€”by paragraphs or pages. Or you can create real theater: one reads the author's words, and the other voices the characters.
ideas: Try changing your voice to portray different characters. Don't be afraid to overactâ€”it's fun!
If there are sounds in the story (a door knock, wind howling), act them out

steps.title: Diving into the Plot: The Magic of Intonation
steps.subtitle: Bringing Words to Life
steps.content: Start reading aloud, without rushing. Enjoy the timbre of your partner's voice, pour emotion into the words, play with intonationâ€”from whispers to exclamations. Your goal isn't speed, but atmosphere.
ideas: Use your phone's flashlight to illuminate the text, creating a mysterious setting
Play ambient or instrumental music in the background that fits the story's mood

steps.title: Bookmark on the Page: Pause for Thoughts
steps.subtitle: Interactive Reading
steps.content: Don't be afraid to stop at the most interesting moments. Take pauses to share thoughts or ask each other questions.
ideas: "What do you think he'll do next? What would you do in his place?"
"Do you feel sympathy for this character? Why?"
"This situation reminds me of something from our life..."

steps.title: Final Touch: After the Epilogue
steps.subtitle: Reflection Time
steps.content: When the story is finished, don't rush back to reality. Discuss the ending: what does it mean to you? What emotions did the story leave? What details did one notice that the other missed?
ideas: Come up with and write down one sentence as a continuationâ€”"And a year later, the characters..." Save this note as an artifact of your literary evening

artdialogue.title: Art Dialogue - Date Plan
artdialogue.subtitle: Date Plan
artdialogue.heroSubtitle: Sometimes feelings are easier to express not with words, but with color and form. This date turns you into a duo of artists creating a shared canvas

checklist.title: Canvas
items: One large sheet of drawing paper or canvas on a stretcher
two sets of paints (gouache or acrylic)
brushes
palette
water cups

checklist.title: Studio
items: Cover the floor or table with plastic
ensure good lighting

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Put on a creative playlist (from light jazz to indie rock)
light an aromatic candle

dresscode.title: Free Artists
dresscode.description: Old white t-shirts that will become part of the art object

dresscode.title: Masters of Bohemia
dresscode.description: Berets, scarves, and creative chaos in clothing

dresscode.title: Art Therapists
dresscode.description: Maximally comfortable tracksuits

steps.title: Monologue in Color: First Touch
steps.subtitle: Individual Expression
steps.content: Divide the canvas in half (mentally or with a light pencil line). For 10-15 minutes, each person silently paints on their half, expressing their current mood or emotion. Don't think about the subject, trust your intuition.
ideas: Try to paint music: smooth lines for slow melodies, sharp strokes for fast ones
Depict your day in color: yellow spots of joy, gray streaks of tiredness

steps.title: Response Gesture: Continuing the Story
steps.subtitle: Artistic Dialogue
steps.content: Now the most interesting part: switch places. Your task isn't to redo, but to complement your partner's drawing. Respond to their colors with yours, connect their lines with yours, turn their abstract spot into something new.
ideas: If your partner drew a circle, turn it into a sun, planet, or eye
Draw your lines across the border, symbolically uniting the two halves

steps.title: Duet: Final Touches
steps.subtitle: Creating Unity
steps.content: Return to your places or work on the painting together, no longer dividing it into halves. Add finishing accents that will make the canvas a unified whole.
ideas: Find a place in the center of the painting for a shared symbol, meaningful only to you
Leave handprints on the canvas, intertwined together

steps.title: Final Touch: Gallery Opening for Two
steps.subtitle: The Reveal
steps.content: Put the finished painting in a visible place. Hold a playful presentation: take turns telling what you wanted to depict and what you saw in your partner's work.
ideas: Come up with a title for your painting and take a photo with it, as if at a gallery opening. This canvas will become not just decor, but a true relic of your union

mapofhorizons.title: Map of Horizons - Date Plan
mapofhorizons.subtitle: Date Plan
mapofhorizons.heroSubtitle: Dreaming alone is pleasant, but dreaming together means charting a course to a shared future. This date turns abstract wishes into a visible treasure map

checklist.title: Tools
items: Large sheet of drawing paper or cork board
colored markers
pens
sticky notes

checklist.title: Props
items: Old magazines for cutouts
scissors
glue
pushpins

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Spacious spot on the floor or at a large table
soft lighting
inspiring playlist (soundtracks from motivational films, epic music)

dresscode.title: Architects of the Future
dresscode.description: Comfortable but neat home clothes (shirts, polos)

dresscode.title: Great Dreamers
dresscode.description: Cozy pajamas or onesies

dresscode.title: Time Travelers
dresscode.description: Clothes that remind you of your favorite trips

steps.title: Near Horizon: "One Year" Section
steps.subtitle: Immediate Dreams
steps.content: In the center of the map, draw a circle or column labeled "Our Next Year." Fill it with concrete, achievable plans for the next 12 months. These can be both small joys and important steps.
ideas: Use different colored sticky notes for categories: "Travel," "Skills," "Purchases," "Experiences"
Examples: "Weekend trip to a nearby city," "Learn to cook paella together," "Take a massage course," "Once a month, have a surprise date"

steps.title: Middle Distance: "Five Years" Section
steps.subtitle: Medium-Term Goals
steps.content: Around the central zone, create a "Our Five-Year Plan" section. Here you can place larger, more ambitious goals requiring time and preparation.
ideas: Use magazine cutouts for visualization: dream house, dog breed, country for a big trip
Examples: "Get a corgi named Bagel," "Save for a down payment," "Learn Italian for a trip to Tuscany," "Run a half-marathon"

steps.title: Distant Stars: "Ten Years and Beyond" Section
steps.subtitle: Big Dreams
steps.content: On the edges of the map, place your boldest, most boundless fantasies. In this section, there's no such word as "impossible." Allow yourself to dream big.
ideas: Don't limit yourself to reality. Write down everything that comes to mind
Examples: "Open a little cafÃ© by the sea," "Write a book together," "Live abroad for a year," "Collect a vinyl record collection"

steps.title: Final Touch: Compass Check
steps.subtitle: Reflection and Action
steps.content: When the map is ready, hang it in a visible place. Look at it from a distance and discuss: which dreams overlapped? What was a revelation about your partner's desires?
ideas: Choose one small dream from the "One Year" section and agree to take the first step toward making it happen next week. Photograph your mapâ€”let it become your phone wallpaper

storyinframes.title: Story in Frames - Date Plan
storyinframes.subtitle: Date Plan
storyinframes.heroSubtitle: In our phone galleries are gigabytes of memories we rarely revisit. This date is a chance to rescue the best moments from digital oblivion

checklist.title: Materials
items: Empty photo album with cardboard pages
glue stick
scissors
double-sided tape

checklist.title: Decorations
items: Colored pens
decorative stickers
washi tape
scraps of beautiful paper

checklist.title: Content
items: Pre-selected (or printed) 30-50 photos together

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Spacious, well-lit spot
nostalgic playlist with songs that were popular at the start of your relationship

dresscode.title: Memory Keepers
dresscode.description: Cozy vintage-style sweaters

dresscode.title: Archivists
dresscode.description: Comfortable home clothes you can sit on the floor in for hours

dresscode.title: Photo Chronicle Heroes
dresscode.description: Matching t-shirts or clothes in the same color scheme

steps.title: Casting: Finding the Best Shots
steps.subtitle: Photo Selection
steps.content: If you haven't done this beforehand, start with the most engaging partâ€”selecting photos together. Rule: each person chooses 20-25 shots. Be sure to include not only beautiful ones, but funny, silly, and candid shots too.
ideas: Create award categories: "Silliest Selfie," "Photo Better Never Shown to Anyone," "Shot Full of Love"
Find your very first photo together

steps.title: Direction: Storyboarding
steps.subtitle: Creating the Narrative
steps.content: Lay all selected photos on the floor and decide in what order they'll appear in the album. Will it be strict chronology or thematic spreads?
ideas: Thematic spreads: "Our Travels," "Conquering Culinary Heights," "Home Silliness," "Celebrations"
You could start with recent photos and move backward to the beginning of your relationship, like in the movie "Memento"

steps.title: Chronicle: Pages Come to Life
steps.subtitle: Assembly Time
steps.content: The most creative stage: glue in photos and add captions. Don't limit yourself to dates and locations. Write jokes, quotes born that day, or little stories.
ideas: Come up with funny captions from the perspective of people in the photos
Draw little doodles around photos: hearts, arrows, suns
Paste not only photos but tickets, receipts, or pressed flowers connected to that day

steps.title: Final Touch: Premiere Showing
steps.subtitle: The Big Reveal
steps.content: When the last page is filled, hold a ceremonial presentation. Slowly flip through the album from beginning to end, sharing memories that didn't fit in the captions.
ideas: On the last page, leave space for a new photo you'll take right now, holding the finished album. This will be a beautiful full stop and simultaneously the beginning of a new chapter

ourrhymes.title: Our Rhymes - Date Plan
ourrhymes.subtitle: Date Plan
ourrhymes.heroSubtitle: You don't need to be a poet to talk about feelings in verse. This date is a playful game with words, rhythm, and memories

checklist.title: Tools
items: Paper and pens
notebooks
or even one large board with markers

checklist.title: Inspiration
items: You can grab a poetry collection (like the amusing 'gariki' by Igor Guberman or lyrics by Vera Polozkova)

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Soft candlelight
quiet background music (instrumental jazz or lounge)

dresscode.title: Bohemia
dresscode.description: Turtlenecks, berets, and artsy scarves

dresscode.title: Couch Poets
dresscode.description: Cozy sweaters and warm socks

dresscode.title: Rhyme Weavers
dresscode.description: Funny pajamas that set a lighthearted mood

topics.title: Poem Topic Ideas
items: "Ode to Our Cat (or Other Pet)"
"Ballad About How We Chose Wallpaper"
"Epic of the First Date"
"Haiku About Morning Coffee"
"Epic Saga of the Trip to IKEA"

steps.title: First Line: Setting the Theme
steps.subtitle: Choosing Your Subject
steps.content: Start by choosing a topic. It can be something grand and romantic or, conversely, maximally mundane and funny. The simpler the topic, the funnier the result.
ideas: Write several topics on slips of paper and draw one randomly
Choose the brightest shared memory from the last month

steps.title: Poetic Relay: Stanza by Stanza
steps.subtitle: Building Together
steps.content: There are several game options. You can write one line at a time, trying to continue your partner's thought and rhyme. Or each person can write a quatrain on the given topic, then combine them.
ideas: Try the Japanese "renga" format, where each person writes three or two lines, continuing the previous ones
Make it harder: agree that the poem must include the words "pineapple," "cosmodrome," and "sock"

steps.title: Bouts-RimÃ©s: Rhyme Game
steps.subtitle: Surprise Poetry
steps.content: Another fun variation. One of you writes two rhyming lines on paper, folds the sheet so only the second line is visible, and passes it to your partner. They come up with a rhyme for the visible line, fold the sheet again, and pass it back. At the end, you unfold it and read the resulting absurd masterpiece.
ideas: Try this multiple times to create a collection of funny verses

steps.title: Final Touch: Author's Reading
steps.subtitle: Performance Time
steps.content: When the poems are ready, hold a "poetry evening." With expression and drama, read to each other what you've created. Applause is mandatory!
ideas: Choose the best or funniest poem, beautifully rewrite it on a postcard, and hang it on the fridge as a manifesto of your creative union

freezeframe.title: Freeze Frame - Date Plan
freezeframe.subtitle: Date Plan
freezeframe.heroSubtitle: Professional photo shoots are beautiful, but the most alive and genuine shots are born from goofing around when nobody's posing

checklist.title: Equipment
items: Camera or phone with timer
tripod (or substituteâ€”stack of books, chair)

checklist.title: Props
items: Everything at handâ€”hats, glasses, scarves, blankets, string lights, sparklers, glasses, favorite mug

checklist.title: Locations
items: Choose 2-3 spots in the house with good light or interesting background (windowsill, couch with pillows, kitchen, hallway mirror)

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Energetic, fun playlist that makes you move and smile

dresscode.title: Supermodels on the Couch
dresscode.description: Beautiful matching pajamas or robes

dresscode.title: Comedy Heroes
dresscode.description: Bright, fun, or even ridiculous clothing

dresscode.title: Total Black/White
dresscode.description: Dress in one color, always looks stylish in photos

steps.title: Studio Setup: Lights, Camera, Action!
steps.subtitle: Preparing the Space
steps.content: Organize shooting zones. Set your phone on timer (burst mode for 10-20 shots is your best friend), adjust lighting, arrange props within reach.
ideas: Build a fort from pillows and blanketsâ€”it's a great backdrop and cozy hideaway
Use string lights to create beautiful bokeh lights in the background

steps.title: Classic Genre: Posed Shots
steps.subtitle: Warming Up
steps.content: Start with simple, sweet poses to warm up. Hugs, kisses, doing something together (reading a book, drinking cocoa).
ideas: Try recreating a shot from a famous romantic film ("Titanic" on the couch, "Ghost" in the kitchen)
Make a series of "photo booth" photos: four quick frames with different funny faces

steps.title: "Live" Mode: Capture the Moment
steps.subtitle: The Real Magic
steps.content: This is the main stage. Set burst mode on timer and just live: dance, have pillow fights, make sandwiches together, laugh, tell each other jokes. The best shots happen when you forget about the camera.
ideas: Turn on a favorite upbeat song and dance wildly
Try giving each other funny hairstyles

steps.title: Final Touch: One-Evening Exhibition
steps.subtitle: Reviewing the Results
steps.content: After the shoot, get comfortable and look through everything you captured. Don't delete failed shotsâ€”they're often the funniest.
ideas: Choose 3 winners in categories: "Most Romantic Shot," "Funniest Fail," and "Photo That Needs to Be Printed." Create a separate album on your phone named after this evening

academyfortwo.title: Academy for Two - Date Plan
academyfortwo.subtitle: Date Plan
academyfortwo.heroSubtitle: We often know what coffee our partner likes, but don't always realize what universe hides in their hobbies. This date is a chance to become professor and student for each other

checklist.title: Talking Points
items: Each person chooses beforehand a topic for their 15-minute 'lecture'

checklist.title: Visual Aids
items: Can use laptop for presentation
whiteboard with markers
or just a notebook with drawings

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Create an 'academic' settingâ€”desk lamp, chair as 'podium'
quiet background music (classical or neoclassical)

dresscode.title: Professoriate
dresscode.description: Blazer or cardigan over home clothes, glasses for gravitas

dresscode.title: Eternal Students
dresscode.description: Cozy university sweatshirts and hoodies

dresscode.title: Auditors
dresscode.description: Comfortable pajamas, ready to absorb knowledge while lying down

topics.title: Lecture Topic Examples
items: "Why This Music Album Is the Greatest in History: Analysis with Examples"
"Fundamentals of Perfect Tea Brewing: From Temperature to Mood"
"Brief History of My Favorite Video Game: Why It's Art"
"Philosophy of Cats: What Our Pets Teach Us"
"How Offside Works in Soccer: Explanation for Non-Athletes"

steps.title: Lecture #1: The World of One of Us
steps.subtitle: First Presentation
steps.content: The first "professor" steps up to the "podium" and gives their lecture. The goal is to talk about your passion enthusiastically, interestingly, and simply. The listener can ask clarifying questions and take notes.
ideas: Use objects in the room as visual aids
Include one funny, little-known fact about your topic in the lecture

steps.title: Coffee Break: Scientific Debates
steps.subtitle: Discussion Time
steps.content: After the first lecture, take a small break. Pour tea or coffee, have a cookie, and discuss what you heard. This is time for tricky questions, jokes, and exchanging first impressions.
ideas: Try to argue with one of the lecturer's points, even if you agree
Think of how the knowledge gained could be applied in your life together

steps.title: Lecture #2: New Universe
steps.subtitle: Second Presentation
steps.content: Now the "professors" switch places. The second partner presents their topic, trying to captivate the listener just as their predecessor did.
ideas: Try to find an unexpected connection between your topic and theirs
End the lecture with a practical assignment you can do together (for example, "now let's try listening to this song in a new way")

steps.title: Final Touch: Diploma Ceremony
steps.subtitle: Celebration of Learning
steps.content: At the end of the evening, discuss what new things you learned about each other. What surprised you most? Which of your partner's passions did you want to share?
ideas: Draw playful diplomas for each other "For Best Lecture About..." or "Honorary Expert in..." Hang them in a visible place as a symbol of successfully completing your "Academy"

flavorsoflove.title: Flavors of Love - Date Plan
flavorsoflove.subtitle: Date Plan
flavorsoflove.heroSubtitle: The kitchen isn't just a place for cookingâ€”it's a real stage for creativity, improvisation, and care. This date is a culinary duel where there are no losers

checklist.title: Menu
items: Secretly or openly find out each other's favorite dish (one you can actually cook)

checklist.title: Shopping
items: Go grocery shopping together, turning it into part of the adventure. You can split the list and race to find ingredients

checklist.title: Props
items: Beautiful aprons
chef's hats for laughs
all necessary kitchen utensils

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Energetic playlist (from Italian pop to rock 'n' roll)
good lighting
and a glass of wine for the chefs

dresscode.title: Head Chefs
dresscode.description: White t-shirts and stylish aprons

dresscode.title: Restaurant Critics
dresscode.description: Elegant but comfortable home attire

dresscode.title: Kitchen Experimenters
dresscode.description: Whatever you don't mind getting flour on

steps.title: On Your Marks, Get Set, Cook!
steps.subtitle: The Competition Begins
steps.content: Start cooking simultaneously in different parts of the kitchen. The task is to prepare your partner's favorite dish, pouring all your love and a bit of creativity into it.
ideas: Have a "knife battle"â€”who can chop vegetables faster and more beautifully
You can cook with backs to each other to keep the intrigue until the very end

steps.title: Kitchen Show: Creative Chaos
steps.subtitle: The Performance
steps.content: Turn the process into a cooking show. Comment on each other's actions, conduct playful interviews ("Chef, what's the secret of your sauce?"), hold blind taste tests of ingredients.
ideas: Come up with an exquisite restaurant name for your dish
Try repeating some trick from famous chefs (carefully though!)

steps.title: Judgment Day: Ceremonial Tasting
steps.subtitle: The Big Reveal
steps.content: When the dishes are ready, beautifully set the table. First present your creations, then taste. Evaluate not only flavor but presentation, originality, and amount of love invested.
ideas: Award each other playful Michelin stars or prizes in categories: "Most Soulful Dish," "For Will to Win," "Best Aroma"
Try to guess the "secret ingredient" your partner added

steps.title: Final Touch: Recipe for Our Evening
steps.subtitle: Closing Time
steps.content: After dinner full of compliments and laughter, relax and discuss your culinary experience. Cleaning can also be part of the dateâ€”turn on music and dance with the mop.
ideas: Start a "Book of Our Recipes" and write these two dishes in it as the very first entries, definitely adding the date and a couple of funny moments from this evening

temporaryink.title: Temporary Ink - Date Plan
temporaryink.subtitle: Date Plan
temporaryink.heroSubtitle: Today you'll create paintings that can't be hung on a wallâ€”because they live on the body. An evening about attention, contact, and inspiration

checklist.title: Space
items: Create a cozy 'studio': cover the floor or bed with fabric
place a bowl of warm water nearby
soft towels
napkins

checklist.title: Props
items: Body paints or face paint (can add gold or pearlescent accents)
brushes of different sizes, sponges, cotton swabs
timer or music playlist
mirror to admire the results

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Warm lighting
instrumental music with rhythm that helps concentration
light chill or soundtracks (In the Mood for Love, Massive Attack, Alt-J)
add scent: sandalwood, vanilla, or orange zest

dresscode.title: Artist and Canvas
dresscode.description: White shirt, open shoulders or back

dresscode.title: Creative Studio
dresscode.description: Old t-shirts and shorts you don't mind getting dirty

dresscode.title: Minimalism
dresscode.description: Just a blanket or towel, keeping skin exposed

steps.title: Warm-Up: "Guess the Drawing"
steps.subtitle: Awakening Touch and Attention
steps.content: One person closes their eyes, the other draws simple shapesâ€”a star, zigzag, spiral, arrow, letter. The task is to guess what's being drawn.
ideas: Try drawing everything on one body areaâ€”for example, on the back or stomach, to 'awaken' touch and attention

steps.title: Silent Canvas: "I Draw What I Feel"
steps.subtitle: Pure Creativity
steps.content: Now guessing stops, and pure creativity begins. One person is the canvas, the other is the artist. The artist draws what they feel in the moment: not a subject, but a mood. These can be lines, strokes, spotsâ€”anything that reflects inner rhythm. While one draws, the other listens to music, focusing on sensations.
ideas: Try drawing to musicâ€”let each track dictate its own color and movement
Choose a body partâ€”for example, arm, back, legâ€”and turn it into a 'mini-painting'

steps.title: Reflection: "Your Mark on Me"
steps.subtitle: Drawing Your Partner
steps.content: Now you switch roles. But this time the artist doesn't draw what they feel inside, but how they perceive their partnerâ€”their energy, mood, character. To stay focused, use these prompts:
ideas: "I draw only with round shapes"â€”about your partner's softness and tenderness
"Only in blue"â€”about their favorite color
"As if my partner is an element" (fire, water, air, earth)
You can set a time limitâ€”for example, 5 minutes per drawing, so you don't overthink and draw intuitively

steps.title: Photograph Your Artwork
steps.subtitle: Preserving the Moment
steps.content: When a drawing is on the bodyâ€”it lives briefly. Photos help preserve this moment, mood, and see yourself through another's eyes. Have a small photoshoot of each other.
ideas: You can create interesting titles for your drawings, as if in a contemporary art gallery

steps.title: Final Touch: "Washing Away, Leaving Behind"
steps.subtitle: Gentle Closure
steps.content: Carefully wash off the paint from each other with warm water, sponge, or cloth. Do this slowly, as a continuation of the ritual. Then wrap yourselves in towels or blankets, make tea.
ideas: Discuss what you felt during the process, which drawings resonated most, what surprised you about seeing yourself as art

eveningquestionnaire.title: Evening Questionnaire - Date Plan
eveningquestionnaire.subtitle: Date Plan
eveningquestionnaire.heroSubtitle: An exciting game of 'spies' where you test how well you know each other's habits and secrets. Not so much a chance to win as it is a chance to be surprised and learn something new

checklist.title: Dossier
items: Each person secretly prepares a list of 10-15 questions about themselves in advance

checklist.title: Tools
items: Paper and pens for answers
erasable boards can be used

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Dim table lamp lighting
soundtracks from spy films or mysterious jazz playing in the background

dresscode.title: Private Detectives
dresscode.description: Dressing gowns worn like cloaks and a serious expression

dresscode.title: Keepers of Secrets
dresscode.description: All black, like real secret agents

dresscode.title: Analysts
dresscode.description: Cosy jumpers and glasses (even if you have perfect vision)

topics.title: Sample Questions
items: What is my favourite season and why?
What film could I watch over and over again?
What superpower would I choose?
What is the most ridiculous purchase I still laugh about?
Who was my first friend at school?

steps.title: Biased Questioning: Round One
steps.subtitle: The Investigation Begins
steps.content: One of you becomes the 'agent' and reads out your questions. The second ('subject') answers, trying to guess the correct answer. The agent maintains an air of mystery and remains impassive.
ideas: Ask questions with different intonations to confuse the 'subject'
Allow the 'subject' to take one '50/50 hint' for the entire round

steps.title: Verification of Answers: A Reward for Attentiveness
steps.subtitle: The Reveal
steps.content: The 'agent' reveals the correct answers. For each match, the 'subject' receives a pre-agreed prize.
ideas: Prizes can be simple and sweet: a kiss, a shoulder massage, your favourite candy, the right to choose tomorrow's film
You can keep score on a board to add excitement

steps.title: Role Reversal: The Return Move
steps.subtitle: Tables Turned
steps.content: Now the 'subject' becomes the 'agent' and conducts their own round of 'interrogation'. The task is to win back or strengthen the lead in the score.
ideas: Try to catch your partner out with a question that they definitely should know but may have forgotten
Add one joke question that has no correct answer

steps.title: Final Chord: Summing Up
steps.subtitle: The Debrief
steps.content: After two rounds, discuss the results. Which answers surprised you? What new things did you learn? Which questions were the most difficult?
ideas: Write down the funniest and most unexpected answers of the evening. This 'chronicle' will become your secret memory capsule

dancefloorfortwo.title: Dance Floor for Two - Date Plan
dancefloorfortwo.subtitle: Date Plan
dancefloorfortwo.heroSubtitle: Music is the fastest way to change your mood, and dance is the most sincere way to talk without words. Turn your living room into a private dance club

checklist.title: Playlist
items: Gather tracks of different genres in advance—from slow ballads to fiery funk or rock 'n' roll

checklist.title: Dance Floor
items: Clear some space in the room by moving the furniture aside

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Dim the lights
turn on fairy lights, a disco ball or just candles to set the mood

dresscode.title: Freedom of Movement
dresscode.description: Comfortable sports trousers and T-shirts

dresscode.title: Ball at the Palace
dresscode.description: Dress up in your most beautiful clothes, even if they contrast with the surroundings

dresscode.title: Pyjama Disco
dresscode.description: Funny pyjamas or kigurumi for maximum relaxation

steps.title: Warm-up: The First Dance
steps.subtitle: Finding Your Rhythm
steps.content: Start with something slow and calm. This will help you tune in to each other, feel the rhythm and connect. Don't think about the movements, just hug each other and sway to the music.
ideas: Dance with your eyes closed to feel your partner better
Choose a song that you both have fond memories of

steps.title: Dance Improvisation: A Game of Associations
steps.subtitle: Creative Movement
steps.content: To avoid awkward pauses, turn dancing into a game. Give each other funny tasks to perform in movement to the music.
ideas: Dance as if you were sneaking around
Dance as if you are looking for your other sock in the morning
Show us the dance of the winner who has just finished everything

steps.title: Battle: Who Will Outdance Whom?
steps.subtitle: Friendly Competition
steps.content: Put on the most energetic track and have a fun competition. The goal is not to win, but to make each other laugh and release energy.
ideas: Take turns showing one move that your partner must repeat and add their own to it
Try to synchronously repeat the moves from a famous music video

steps.title: Final Chord: Our Special Dance
steps.subtitle: The Perfect Ending
steps.content: End the evening with a dance to the song that best describes your relationship. Let it become your unofficial 'couple's dance'.
ideas: Ask Siri or Google Assistant to 'remember this moment' and record video of the last 30 seconds of your dance

fitnessfortwo.title: Fitness for Two - Date Plan
fitnessfortwo.subtitle: Date Plan
fitnessfortwo.heroSubtitle: Training together is about support, synchronisation and team spirit. Turn sport into a fun game where you cheer each other on and recharge your batteries

checklist.title: Equipment
items: Yoga mats or just a soft carpet
water bottles
towels

checklist.title: Music
items: Put together a playlist with the most energetic and motivating tracks

checklist.title: Space
items: Make sure you have enough room to move around

dresscode.title: Dream Team
dresscode.description: Sportswear in the same colour scheme or matching T-shirts

dresscode.title: Olympic Reserve
dresscode.description: The brightest and most fun sports outfits possible

dresscode.title: Zen Masters
dresscode.description: Comfortable leggings, shorts and tops for yoga or stretching

steps.title: Warm-up: Getting Ready to Start
steps.subtitle: Preparing Your Body
steps.content: Start with a light 5-minute warm-up to prepare your muscles. Simple swings, bends, joint rotations. Do this in sync, looking at each other.
ideas: Turn your warm-up into a game of 'Follow Me'
Set a timer and change exercises every 30 seconds

steps.title: Main Set: Partner Work
steps.subtitle: Building Trust
steps.content: Move on to exercises that require interaction. This develops trust and a sense of partnership.
ideas: Squats while holding hands: stand facing each other and squat simultaneously, creating a counterbalance
Push-ups with clapping: stand facing each other and clap your partner's palm after each push-up
Passing the ball: sit on the floor back to back and pass a ball or pillow to each other, twisting your torso

steps.title: Competitive Spirit: Fun Challenges
steps.subtitle: Adding Excitement
steps.content: Add an element of gambling. Organise several mini-competitions where the winner receives a symbolic prize.
ideas: Plank 'who can make whom laugh': stand in a plank position facing each other. The task is to hold the position, while the other's task is to make them laugh by any means necessary (except tickling)
'Chair' against the wall: whoever stays in this position the longest gets to choose the film for the evening

steps.title: Final Chord: Cool Down and Relax
steps.subtitle: Recovery Time
steps.content: Finish your workout with some gentle stretching. This will help relax your muscles and smoothly transition from activity to rest.
ideas: Give each other a light shoulder or calf massage. Afterwards, prepare healthy smoothies and celebrate your 'victory' over laziness

surprisebox.title: Surprise Box - Date Plan
surprisebox.subtitle: Date Plan
surprisebox.heroSubtitle: The most valuable gifts don't have a price tag. Become secret magicians for each other, preparing inexpensive but meaningful items for your 'treasure box'

checklist.title: Surprises
items: Each person secretly buys 3-4 small symbolic gifts for their partner in advance. The budget is minimal

checklist.title: Storage
items: Find a beautiful box or casket that will become your 'memory capsule'

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Create a festive mood with candles, garlands and light, pleasant music

dresscode.title: Birthday Boys and Girls
dresscode.description: Wear party hats or funny headbands

dresscode.title: Treasure Keepers
dresscode.description: Cosy jumpers with pockets where you can hide surprises

dresscode.title: Wizards
dresscode.description: Add something shiny or iridescent to your clothes

topics.title: Examples of Surprises
items: Your partner's favourite chocolate bar, which is hard to find
Funny socks with a print related to your shared joke
A small Lego or Kinder Surprise figure that references their hobby
Your favourite photo together, printed and framed
A key ring that solves the problem of 'always losing your keys'

steps.title: The Moment of Surprise: Exchanging Gifts
steps.subtitle: The Unveiling
steps.content: Take turns picking out one gift at a time and giving it to your partner. Don't rush, enjoy the moment of unwrapping and the first reaction.
ideas: Wrap each gift in several layers of paper to prolong the intrigue
Before handing over the gift, give three funny clues about what's inside

steps.title: The Story Behind an Item: Why This Particular Item?
steps.subtitle: Sharing the Meaning
steps.content: After the gift is opened, the giver tells the story behind their choice. This is the most important part—not the item itself, but the thought behind it.
ideas: 'I chose this because I remember how you laughed when we saw it last time'
'This item reminds me of your superpower...'

steps.title: Final Chord: Creating a 'Memory Capsule'
steps.subtitle: Building Your Collection
steps.content: When all the surprises have been given and the stories told, solemnly place all the items in your shared box. It becomes your personal museum.
ideas: Write the date of this evening on a small piece of paper and put it in the box with the gifts. Agree to add to it once a year or open it on special occasions

videogamenight.title: Video Game Night - Date Plan
videogamenight.subtitle: Date Plan
videogamenight.heroSubtitle: Video games are a portal to other worlds where you can go together. Become a well-coordinated team or fierce rivals in vivid emotions and laughter

checklist.title: Platform
items: Game console, PC, or even mobile phones with mobile games

checklist.title: Provisions
items: Snacks and drinks that can be eaten without taking your eyes off the screen (pizza, nachos, nuts)

checklist.title: Gaming Area
items: Comfortable sofa or armchairs
cushions
dim lighting so as not to distract from the screen

dresscode.title: Esports Players
dresscode.description: Comfortable hoodies, caps, and gaming headphones

dresscode.title: Fantasy Heroes
dresscode.description: Cosy pyjamas or kigurumi costumes of your favourite characters

dresscode.title: Couch Troops
dresscode.description: The most relaxed home clothes possible

topics.title: Examples of Games for Two
items: Cooperative (team play): It Takes Two, Overcooked, Portal 2, A Way Out
Competitive (friend vs. friend): racing (Mario Kart, Need for Speed), fighting (Mortal Kombat, Street Fighter)
Fun and simple: any games from the Jackbox Games series, mobile Heads Up! or Draw Something

steps.title: Choosing the Arena: Team or Duel?
steps.subtitle: Setting the Stage
steps.content: First, decide how you want to spend your evening. Will you work together to complete a challenging mission, or will you organise a tournament to find out who is today's 'couch champion'?
ideas: You can combine the two: start with a cooperative game to warm up, and finish with a competitive contest
If you are playing a competitive game, agree on a 'prize for the winner'

steps.title: Start of the Tournament: The Game is On!
steps.subtitle: Let the Games Begin
steps.content: Immerse yourself in the game! Don't forget to communicate, coordinate your actions, cheer each other on or, conversely, tease your partner. Emotions are the main part of this date.
ideas: If you are playing a competitive game, organise a 'best of three' tournament. The loser of round compliments the winner
Come up with funny names for your team (e.g., 'Couch Crushers')

steps.title: Final Chord: Hall of Fame
steps.subtitle: Celebrating Victory
steps.content: After the game is over, don't rush to turn off the console. Discuss the funniest and most tense moments. Who was the hero of the evening, and who was the most awkward player?
ideas: Take a victory selfie with your joysticks in front of the final credits or scoreboard. Create a separate folder on your phone called 'Our Hall of Fame'

cleaninggame.title: Cleaning Game - Date Plan
cleaninggame.subtitle: Date Plan
cleaninggame.heroSubtitle: Turn the most boring routine into a fun competition. You're 'chaos fighters' and the reward will be cleanliness and a great mood

checklist.title: Arsenal
items: Rags, sponges, detergents, mop, vacuum cleaner, rubbish bags

checklist.title: Timer
items: Phone with a stopwatch or kitchen timer

checklist.title: Soundtrack
items: Make a playlist in advance with the most upbeat and rhythmic music

dresscode.title: Cleaning Special Forces
dresscode.description: Comfortable dark clothing, bandanas on your head

dresscode.title: Dust Hunters
dresscode.description: Old T-shirts and shorts that you don't mind getting dirty

dresscode.title: Cleanliness Fairies
dresscode.description: Something light, bright and funny

steps.title: Division of Territories: Plan of Attack
steps.subtitle: Strategic Planning
steps.content: Examine the 'battlefield' and assign areas of responsibility. You can draw lots to decide who gets the kitchen and who gets the bedroom. Or you can work in the same area but perform different tasks.
ideas: Organise a 'relay race': every 15 minutes, when the timer goes off, switch tasks or rooms
Divide responsibilities: one person is responsible for 'dry' cleaning (dusting, vacuuming), the other is responsible for 'wet' cleaning (washing floors and surfaces)

steps.title: Fighting Chaos: Fun Challenges
steps.subtitle: Game Time
steps.content: Add some game elements to the process. This will turn the routine into a competition and help you move faster.
ideas: Speed cleaning: who can sort through the pile of things on the chair faster? The winner gets the title of 'Master of Order'
Treasure hunt: who can find the most long-lost items (coins, hair clips, lost socks) while tidying up?
Musical freeze frame: cleaning continues while the music plays. As soon as the track stops, everyone must freeze in a funny pose

steps.title: Final Chord: Reward for Your Efforts
steps.subtitle: Mission Accomplished
steps.content: When the last bag of rubbish has been taken out and the rags have been washed, hold a solemn 'work acceptance' ceremony. Walk around the flat, praising each other for the work you have done.
ideas: Order pizza or sushi and have dinner right on the floor in a perfectly clean room. The winner of all challenges is officially exempt from washing the dishes

homespa.title: Home SPA - Date Plan
homespa.subtitle: Date Plan
homespa.heroSubtitle: Turn your bathroom and bedroom into an oasis of calm and care. Become masters of relaxation for each other through simple rituals

checklist.title: Arsenal
items: Fabric face masks, scrubs, aromatic oils or massage cream, bath salts or foam

checklist.title: Accessories
items: Soft towels and bathrobes
scented candles
sticks or a diffuser

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Dim lighting
a playlist with calm music (ambient, nature sounds, lounge)

dresscode.title: Guardians of Relaxation
dresscode.description: Soft bathrobes and fluffy slippers

dresscode.title: Zen Adepts
dresscode.description: Comfortable pyjamas made from natural fabrics

dresscode.title: Lords of the Elements
dresscode.description: Light shorts and T-shirts

steps.title: Cleansing Ritual: Facial Care
steps.subtitle: Beginning the Journey
steps.content: Start with simple and pleasant facial treatments. This will put you in the mood for relaxation.
ideas: Help each other apply clay or fabric masks. Doing this together is great fun!
Make a steam bath for your face by adding a few drops of eucalyptus or lavender essential oil to hot water

steps.title: The Art of Touch: Massage Time
steps.subtitle: Healing Hands
steps.content: Move to the bedroom. Take turns giving each other a light, relaxing massage. You don't need to be a professional; the main thing is to be gentle and attentive.
ideas: Shoulder and neck massage: this is a universal way to relieve tension after a day's work
Foot massage: an incredibly relaxing procedure, especially when using a nourishing cream
Hand massage: we often forget about our hands, but they get tired too

steps.title: Full Immersion: A Bath for Two
steps.subtitle: Complete Relaxation
steps.content: Fill the bath with warm water, add sea salt, foam or a bath bomb. Light candles around the room and immerse yourself in an atmosphere of complete tranquillity.
ideas: Bring along some cool drinks and fruit, such as grapes or strawberries
Play an audiobook or simply lie in silence

steps.title: Final Chord: A State of Weightlessness
steps.subtitle: Perfect Peace
steps.content: After all the procedures, take your time to wrap yourself in warm robes or immediately get under the blanket. Allow yourself to just lie there without discussing anything.
ideas: End the evening with a cup of herbal tea with honey. Try lying in silence for 10 minutes, just holding hands and feeling each other's presence

ourlittlegarden.title: Our Little Garden - Date Plan
ourlittlegarden.subtitle: Date Plan
ourlittlegarden.heroSubtitle: Creating something alive together is a little bit of magic. 'Adopt' a houseplant that will become a silent witness and symbol of your relationship

checklist.title: Main Character
items: Choose an undemanding plant together at the shop (zamioculcas, sansevieria or chlorophytum)

checklist.title: Tools
items: A nice pot or planter
soil
drainage (expanded clay)
gloves
a scoop

checklist.title: Workspace
items: Cover the floor with newspapers or plastic sheeting so you don't have to worry about making a mess

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Light and bright music (indie folk, acoustic covers)
daylight

dresscode.title: Gardeners
dresscode.description: Old jeans and plaid shirts

dresscode.title: Nature Guardians
dresscode.description: Green or earth-toned clothing

dresscode.title: Experimental Florists
dresscode.description: Comfortable overalls or aprons

steps.title: Transplanting: Giving a New Resident a Home
steps.subtitle: Planting Together
steps.content: Prepare the pot together: pour drainage material into the bottom, then add a layer of soil. Carefully remove the plant from the transport pot and place it in the new one, covering it with soil.
ideas: Turn it into a ritual: one person holds the plant, the other carefully works with a trowel
You can place a 'time capsule' at the bottom of the pot before adding soil—a coin or a note with the date and your wishes

steps.title: Art Workshop: Decorating the Pot
steps.subtitle: Making It Personal
steps.content: If you have chosen a simple ceramic or plastic pot, turn it into an art object.
ideas: Paint the pot with acrylic paints: draw patterns, funny faces or your initials
Write the name you have chosen for the plant on it
Decorate it with decorative elements or simply tie a pretty ribbon around it

steps.title: Making a Schedule: A Care Plan
steps.subtitle: Shared Responsibility
steps.content: Your 'pet' needs care. Discuss and decide who will water, spray and feed it, and when.
ideas: Come up with a name and personality for the plant. For example, 'Igor the Cactus, a little prickly, but kind at heart'
Hang a funny 'watering schedule' on the refrigerator so you don't forget

steps.title: Final Touch: A Place of Honour
steps.subtitle: Finding the Perfect Spot
steps.content: Find the best place in your home for your new green friend. Put it where it will be pleasing to the eye and remind you of that warm evening.
ideas: Take a 'family portrait'—the two of you and your new plant. Agree to take a photo with it every six months to see how you are all growing together

rolereversal.title: Role Reversal - Date Plan
rolereversal.subtitle: Date Plan
rolereversal.heroSubtitle: Ever wondered what it would be like to spend an evening in your partner's shoes? A fun theatrical experiment where you swap clothes and habits

checklist.title: Wardrobe
items: Each person prepares a complete set of their clothes for their partner in advance (from socks to a shirt or dress)

checklist.title: Setting
items: You will need a large mirror and a phone for photos and videos

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: Put on a fun and dynamic playlist that puts you in the mood for silliness

dresscode.title: Partner's Choice
dresscode.description: On this date, your partner decides the dress code! Be prepared for anything

steps.title: Transformation: A Reverse Fashion Show
steps.subtitle: The Big Switch
steps.content: The funniest moment is getting dressed. Help each other cope with unfamiliar clothes. When the looks are ready, organise a funny fashion show to music, walk around the room with your partner's 'signature' gait.
ideas: Take a series of 'before' and 'after' photos
Shoot a short video of yourselves posing in your new outfits

steps.title: Immerse Yourself in the Look: An Evening in a New Role
steps.subtitle: Living the Experience
steps.content: Spend at least an hour wearing each other's clothes. Try doing your usual activities: making tea, scrolling through your phone, watching TV, but in your new look.
ideas: Try sitting on the sofa or in an armchair in your partner's favourite position
Talk on the phone with an imaginary interlocutor, using their typical phrases and intonations

steps.title: One-Person Theatre: Parodying Habits
steps.subtitle: Friendly Imitation
steps.content: This is the highlight of the evening. Take turns showing each other friendly parodies of characteristic gestures, facial expressions or phrases. The main thing is to do it in a friendly manner.
ideas: 'What you look like when you're concentrating on your work'
'Your face when you see a cute cat'
'Your favourite phrase when you don't want to wash the dishes'

steps.title: Final Chord: Returning to Yourself
steps.subtitle: Reflection Time
steps.content: After the game, change back into your own clothes and discuss your impressions. It wasn't just a masquerade, but an interesting experience.
ideas: Share one discovery you made about your partner or yourself. For example: 'I never thought your jeans would be so comfortable!'

boardgamenight.title: Board Game Night - Date Plan
boardgamenight.subtitle: Date Plan
boardgamenight.heroSubtitle: Board games are a ready-made universe in a box, full of excitement, strategy and unexpected twists. Your personal gaming marathon

checklist.title: Game Library
items: Choose 2-3 different types of board games in advance

checklist.title: Snacks
items: Prepare a 'game table' with drinks and food that is easy to eat with your hands (nuts, crisps, sliced fruit, mini pizzas)

checklist.title: Atmosphere
items: A comfortable place at the table or on the floor
dim warm lighting
background music that does not interfere with thinking

dresscode.title: Grandmasters
dresscode.description: Cosy robes or kigurumi

dresscode.title: Lords of the Dice
dresscode.description: Comfortable tracksuits or pyjamas

dresscode.title: Bluff Masters
dresscode.description: Loungewear, but with one 'serious' element, such as a hat or bow tie

topics.title: Examples of Games for Two
items: Strategy games: Carcassonne, 7 Wonders: Duel, Patchwork, Hive
Fun and fast: Uno, Dobble, Equivoke for Two, Code Names: Duet
Classics: chess, checkers, backgammon

steps.title: Choosing Your Weapons: Deciding on the Evening's Arsenal
steps.subtitle: Game Selection
steps.content: Lay out all the prepared games and decide which one to start with. It is better to move from simpler and faster games to more complex and longer ones, or vice versa—start with the main 'dish' while you still have the energy.
ideas: Hold a draw to choose the first game
Agree that the loser of one game chooses the next

steps.title: The Start of the Tournament: A Battle of Wits and Luck
steps.subtitle: Let the Games Begin
steps.content: Immerse yourself in the game! Explain the rules if anyone has forgotten them and start the game. Don't forget to joke around, comment on moves and create friendly competition.
ideas: Organise a tournament with up to three wins. The winner receives a humorous title, such as 'King of Carcassonne'
Introduce a rule: before each turn, players must compliment their partner

steps.title: Final Chord: Honouring the Winners
steps.subtitle: Celebration Time
steps.content: After the last game, sum up the results. It doesn't matter who won on points—on an evening like this, both sides are winners.
ideas: Create a 'challenge cup'—it can be any funny thing in your house (a statuette, a mug, a soft toy). The winner keeps it until the next board game night
